ratings.comment: Nope - didn't care for her. Yes she is engaged and cares about the topic but only from her perspective. You have to be a member of the choir to like her style of teaching and this course. If you have any critical evaluations of alternative food politics & systems this class will drive you crazy. And I don't mean negative - just different perspectiv
Very nice and helpful. Passionate about her line of work. Lecture always flies by because it is very interesting and engaging.
Very nice and helpful. Passionate about her line of work. Lecture always flies by because it is very interesting and engaging.
Jill is pretty awesome.  I would recommend SOC 650 with her even if you don't think you have much of an interest in food issues.  The course readings are all revelevant and classtime is used well.
Really helpful and very knowledgeable of what she speaks about.  Also pretty easy on the eyes.  Definitely would take her again.

Great class for anyone semi-interested in food, farming and food-related issues.  Lectures are always really engaging.  Jill is good at encouraging students to think critically about material, not just making them memorize things.  She is passionate about this stuff and makes her students become so.

AMAZING!  By far the best professor I've ever had at this school. The course was a RANDOM pick for me, thought it might be cool, ended up being the most informative and relevant class I've ever taken.  Hard class in the sense that it's a lot of reading and writing, but so worth it, and she's a ridiculously fair grader.  Can't say enough!! GREAT!!

Jill really cares about what she teaches and is knowledgeable about the subject. She makes the class interactive and makes an effort to get to know you. She helps you consider social and environmental issues in new and important ways and has great speakers come in to break up the lectures. The readings are usually interesting.
